H0.text: Organelles are absent in organisms belonging to the phylum Porifera, whose cells are not organized into tissues.

H1.text: Cells are absent in organisms belonging to the phylum Porifera, where the cells of organisms found in that phylum are not organized into tissues.

H2.text: Genes are the structures absent in organisms belonging to the phylum Porifera, whose cells are not organized into tissues.

H3.text: Organs are absent in organisms belonging to the phylum Porifera, where the cells are not organized into tissues.

A4.text: Unlike other animals, they lack true tissues and organs.

A5.text: They do not have complex nervous, digestive or circulatory systems.

A6.text: The less-advanced taxa (i.e. Placozoa, Porifera, Ctenophora and Cnidaria) do not show unification of their tissues into organs.
